product_overview: TextViz is a comprehensive web platform that provides specialized and optimized editing environments for various text-based formats including Markdown, LaTeX, Mermaid diagrams, and a JSON prompt builder for AI generation models. It integrates user authentication, document management, and an AI assistant to enhance productivity and creative workflows.
core_goals: Provide professional and optimized UI/UX tailored to each text/diagram format to maximize work efficiency.
Enable modular and reusable AI prompts through a block system enhancing prompt management.
Ensure each editing tool operates independently with dedicated pages and workflows for user clarity and task focus.
Support seamless user authentication, document storage, and management to facilitate organization and recovery of works.
Incorporate AI assistance to improve user experience and provide helpful interactions across editors.
key_features: Markdown Editor with classic split view, GFM support, document structure navigation, and quick formatting toolbar for general document and blog writing.
LaTeX Studio featuring a document-focused split view with a symbol palette, bibliography management, and PDF export capabilities suited for academic and professional reports.
Mermaid Live providing an interactive diagram canvas with zoom/pan functions, type-specific templates, and high-resolution SVG/PNG export for creating complex diagrams.
JSON Prompt Builder with a three-column layout supporting drag & drop block assembly, form inputs for JSON structures, and block library management for AI prompt creation.
User authentication and login powered by Supabase ensuring secure access and personalized experience.
Document repository with local storage-based persistence allowing users to save, manage, and quickly access their documents across tools.
AI assistant named 'Textie' integrated to provide chat and assistance features across the platform.
Global settings page allowing theme configuration, data backup/restore, and application preferences management.
user_flow_summary: User logs in via the authentication interface to access personalized features.
From the home dashboard, user selects a tool: Markdown Editor, LaTeX Studio, Mermaid Live, or JSON Prompt Builder.
Within each tool, the user creates or loads documents to edit or assemble content using rich, specialized UIs.
User can save work locally in segregated storage keys ensuring data isolation per tool.
Users can invoke the AI assistant 'Textie' for help or content generation suggestions.
In settings, the user can adjust themes, clear data, or backup and restore workspace data as needed.
validation_criteria: All editors (Markdown, LaTeX, Mermaid, JSON Builder) must correctly render and save edited content with appropriate UI feedback.
User authentication must securely handle login, logout, and session persistence without errors.
Document repository must enable reliable saving, loading, and deletion of user documents with local storage isolation.
AI assistant interactions should be responsive, context-aware, and maintain chat history without data loss.
Settings changes, including theme and data backup/restore, must persist correctly and apply immediately.
The application UI must be responsive and performant across supported devices and screen sizes.
